content:
I've tried installing 1.8.1 on both Debian 9 and Ubuntu 18.04 - and in both cases I receive a notification "Unsupported OS release".

Since both of these OS are listed in the Production Installation Documentation, I wanted to check and see if I was missing something.
@Brian Walker they're supported starting with 1.9.0 (not yet released)
You can just clone master and install for those platforms.
Thanks Tim. Is 1.9.0 available as a RC today?
The final release should have come out by now, but I'm the release manager and I've been ill for a few weeks now :frown:.

Hope you are feeling well soon! I am installing production to potentially replace Openfire. Not sure if I'm better of setting up 16.04 with 1.8.1 and upgrading real soon, or setting up 18.04 and installing 1.9.0 :thinking:
Almost certainly 1.9.0 on 18.04 -- you'll save yourself some upgrade work.
Thanks brother. I'll let you know how it goes! :+1:

Only two things worth mentioning:

1. I had to change the scope of repositories to install puppet (and one other package - name evades me ATM)...

sudo add-apt-repository main
sudo add-apt-repository universe

2. I had to forward ports 80 & 443 from my Public IP to Private LAN IP of the Zulip Server (after providing Public DNS). Only mentioning this here as I didn't see it in the documentation - and that may because it should be common knowledge.

Other than that - smooth as silk.
@Brian Walker we mention needing those ports needing to be open in the "requirements" docs, I think.
@Tim Abbott Just checked the "requirements" doc & verified it is indeed mentioned.
faced same issue, will be trying out installation on debian 9 with 1.9.0
So for installing a production server from scratch this week, would you recommend 18.04 and 19-rc2 ? over 16 and 18 ? (hi btw)
@Joe Saraza I think Tim is out for the weekend, but I think 18.04 and 19-rc2 is likely best.
